fixes.name: index
fixes.solution_explanation: Tableau INDEX() is a table calculation that depends on the visual partitioning and sort order and has no direct row-by-row DAX equivalent. In Power BI this is typically implemented as a measure using RANKX over an ordering expression or a unique row identifier, for example: RANKX(ALLSELECTED('historicoEducacionCLEAN (historicoEducacionCLEAN)'), [OrderExpression], , ASC, DENSE). Because the original Tableau calculation provides no partition or ordering column, a direct conversion cannot be produced here; the measure returns BLANK() until an ordering/unique key is specified.
fixes.type_changed_reason: INDEX() is a table calculation (visual/table-aware) in Tableau; such calculations must be created as measures in Power BI.
